instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.AP_RESET_L: What is AP_RESET_L? AP_RESET_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN: What is SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN? SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on power to the wifi circuit when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP3V3_WLAN: What is PP3V3_WLAN? PP3V3_WLAN is a 3.3v power rail that powers the wifi circuit or wifi card. This can go missing when the inductor acting as a fuse before PP3V3_WLAN blows..
definitions.AP_RESET_CONN_R_L: What is AP_RESET_CONN_R_L? AP_RESET_CONN_R_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.message:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Check  <SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_R_L</SIGNAL>  trace and connector contact.
It must drop to 0V, when airport card is attached.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: Yes, it drops to 0. I didn't have the card attached the first time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C3530</CAPACITOR>/31 look great. Traces to connector have continuity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
"J3501 Voltages:
--------------
<SIGNAL>AP_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL>: 32 mv
<SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_Q_L</SIGNAL>: 3.3 v"
Check them again, with airport card connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message:
Reset signal is not good.
You've reported to have 3V there before; check what happened.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no wifi
threads.message: Fixed. The was a semi-blown trace between <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R3558</RESISTOR>. Thank you very much.
